comments.content:
Detailed Report: https://oss-fuzz.com/testcase?key=5805533850894336

Project: libxml2
Fuzzing Engine: afl
Fuzz Target: xml
Job Type: afl_asan_libxml2
Platform Id: linux

Crash Type: Invalid-free
Crash Address: 0x619000000ff8
Crash State:
  xmlFreeProp
  xmlFreeNodeList
  xmlFreeDoc
  
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)

Regressed: https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=afl_asan_libxml2&range=202201270610:202201280606

Reproducer Testcase: https://oss-fuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5805533850894336

Issue filed automatically.

See https://google.github.io/oss-fuzz/advanced-topics/reproducing for instructions to reproduce this bug locally.
When you fix this bug, please
  * mention the fix revision(s).
  * state whether the bug was a short-lived regression or an old bug in any stable releases.
  * add any other useful information.
This information can help downstream consumers.

If you need to contact the OSS-Fuzz team with a question, concern, or any other feedback, please file an issue at https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues. Comments on individual Monorail issues are not monitored.

This bug is subject to a 90 day disclosure deadline. If 90 days elapse
without an upstream patch, then the bug report will automatically
become visible to the public.

ClusterFuzz testcase 5805533850894336 is verified as fixed in https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=afl_asan_libxml2&range=202204190606:202204210608

If this is incorrect, please file a bug on https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues/new

This bug has been fixed. It has been opened to the public.

- Your friendly Sheriffbot

This crash was "fixed" by disabling XPointer locations support by default in libxml2 (so the fuzzer wouldn't hit these code paths anymore):

    Add configuration flag for XPointer locations support
    <https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/commit/670701075b969962db1b869507318e81e96910d1>

But this turned out to be a bug in xmlSetTreeDoc() with a fix tracked here:
<https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/merge_requests/175>
